                                  Task Force on Juvenile Justice


Administration Representatives:

       Bruce Reed

       John Hilley

       Attorney General Reno / Jamie Gorelick

       Secretary Rubin / Ray Kelly

      Chairman Hatch

       Senator Thurmond

       Senator Sessions

       Senator Leahy

       Senator Biden

       Chairman Hyde

       Rep. McCollum

       Rep. Gekas

       Rep. Conyers

       Rep. Schumer


TimeTable:
        President Clinton submitted his comprehensive youth violence legislation, the Anti-Gang
and Youth Violence Act of 1997, to Congress on February 25, 1997. Joint hearings are being
held in the House on February 26th before the Judiciary and Education Committees.

       Since many important provisions in the President's bill are reflected in the 1998 Budget
Submission, it is essential that this legislation be enacted before or at the same time as the
appropriations bill move through Congress this year.
